stories.text: Hello everyone. My team and I have recently launched a service with design generation (https://brandy.ink/), and we would like to know the truthful opinion about our service from the user side. What would you add or remove from our service? Thank you all in advance for the answer.
stories.title: What would you change in the product (add or remove)?

stories.text:
Came across this tweet from broadcaster Hugh Fearnley Whittingstall today:

https://twitter.com/HughFW/status/1495685290698153986

I’m assuming the theory of morphic resonance is nonsense - but I’m wondering if there is any trend of Wordle average solution length by geography?
stories.title: Ask HN: Using Wordle solutions to test theories of morphic resonance
SGPT: GPT Sentence Embeddings for Semantic Search

stories.text:
Every day there are posts here with some Twitter thread as the source.

This used to be just annoying in the past (because of the overall low quality of such sources), but now it's gone too far. Twitter won't let you see the content without logging in anymore. At least this is what I see when I open a Twitter link and scroll down: https://i.imgur.com/E0h2CtQ.png

There are many free blog posting platforms out there that don't annoy users like that and — needless to say — are in a much more readable format. All it takes is a couple of minutes to sign up...

I think such a HN rule could help in promoting common decency on the web.
stories.title: Ask HN: Can we ban Twitter links, please?
